intro: Sciadotenia mathiasiana, commonly known as the Mathiasian sand thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright, sparsely branched stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland desert regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
